DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to gather information on how doctors program particular settings on cardiac resynchronization therapy implantable cardiac defibrillators (CRT-Ds), to analyze how these settings affect the amount of cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) patients receive and to evaluate the therapy approach for converting abnormally fast heartbeats into normal heartbeats. There are no experimental devices or procedures involved in this study.
DOC.criteria: Patient is indicated for a Medtronic CRTD system Patient is willing to sign Permission for Access to and Use of Health Information form Patient is willing and able to comply with followup visits through six months Patient has a life expectancy of less than 6 months Patient is participating in any concurrent study that could confound the results for either study
